address.streetAddress: 230 Queens Quay W West dock, On the water front.

description: City View Cruise offers a range of services from our unique Toronto Island tours to private boat rentals. Book a Toronto Island boat tours and learn the stories that make each island special. Our boat, The "Ste. Marie 1" has a full-service bar on board with washrooms. Tours run 45 minutes to 1 hour long and all ticket purchases include a complementary island drop off and pick up.

reviews.title: Best Sightseeing Tour on the Harbourfront!
text: The Ste. Marie 1 is the hands-down, the best tour and sightseeing experience at the Toronto Harbourfront. My friends and I have been going on this tour for ten years, every summer, and it's always great vibes. The skyline views are top-notch!

reviews.title: Fantastic
text: Super friendly and helpful guys running the tour. Good music and good banter. Can get dropped off at islands to explore and later be picked up to continue tour back to city. Highly recommend

reviews.title: Amazing Boat Tour of Toronto Harbor
text: This tour was very engaging as well as informative. It's great for the whole family!! Crew is great and caring!

reviews.title: Excellent tour
text: Amazing tour of the Toronto Islands area! Staff were super friendly, and provided such an informative yet fun narration! üòçüòç

reviews.title: Great cruise great value
text: I bought a groupon voucher for 4 people, during a groupon sale day, for $44, for a 45-minute cruise.  The voucher says to get there 30 min. before the published cruise time.  We got there 15 min. and was fine.  There were some other people coming, just before sail time.

There was another big boat beside us and the top deck was open, directly under the sun.  Our boat's top deck did have a canopy cover, to provide shade.  That makes a big difference because it was a sunny day and would have been hot without shade.
The cruise was narrated by a young girl.  She spoke fast, so my friend from overseas whose English was ok, said she has difficulty understanding the girl.

We cruised to see a few planes taking off from the Toronto island airport.  The view back to Toronto skyline with CN Tower and Rogers Centre, and other highrises, was excellent.  Once a while there'd be a plane flying by or other boats sail by.  All made for great photo taking.  My friends were so happy with the very nice sunny weather and the views.
We sailed into the islands, then back out.  This was excellent value for the money - especially if you can buy it from groupon on a discount.

reviews.title: Great experience with great tour guides
text: This was a great experience for friends visiting the city. It is priced reasonably and our tour guide Ellen was great! She was funny and informative during our tour.

reviews.title: Tall Ships
text: I had the pleasure of taking a lake Ontario boat tour again yesterday on this ship. The crew as always are excellent and we had beautiful weather. The captain went out of his way to go down past the tall ships and allow everybody time to take pictures and videos which was amazing. Kenny‚Äôs dialogue is hilarious, everyone enjoyed a lovely trip. This is the best boat trip from Harbourfront.

reviews.title: St. Marie Boat Cruise Toronto Harbour
text: My wife and I decided to take a Toronto Harbour boat cruise today on the St. Marie.  We enjoyed it immensely.  The excursion took us across the harbour and the Islands.  We enjoyed the trip and the information provided.  I would recommend this trip for the money and time.  We will go again.

reviews.title: Come back ...
text: After three years of silence I have decided to write another review ... because I was really inspired by Sean, the Captain and the silent barman.
Everything was perfect - the music - a colorful narrative - perfect boat handling - in a nutshell a wonderful excursion ...

reviews.title: Worth it, totally worth it!
text: My experience was amazing. Kenny was the best. Very funny, he tells many many jokes.
I followed his suggestions and I really got amazingly delicious food.
The boat those have bar and washroom on board and the staff was very friendly.
Totally suggestible for families.

reviews.title: A delightful water tour
text: Took a delightful tour around the Toronto Islands on the Ste Marie 1 this afternoon. Delightful and helpful staff. The scenery was gorgeous. Toronto's skyline is a must see. Hoping to go back next summer with my extended family, get off on the Island and make a day of it.

reviews.title: Do it in September!
text: My daughter wanted one of her graduation gifts to be a boat ride around the Toronto islands, but we just had a busy summer and never got around to doing it.  September came, warm, sunny, perfect for a boat ride.  We went down to the Harbourfront and boarded our boat with only four other people, a total of 7.  One of the staff told us that they usually require a minimum of 10 passengers to leave the harbour, but they took off anyway - perfect.  The young lady who provided information about the Toronto islands was very pleasant and even offered to take pictures of people on the boat.  The tour is prices slightly lower than most other operators and if, like me, you get it on Groupon you can have this fun experience for close to nothing. We will definitely do it again and will make sure we do it at he end of the season when the boats are not as crowded as they are in July.

reviews.title: Nice trip
text: Found this as we were walking to have a late lunch. Boat leaving in five minutes. Priced very well. Enjoy trip through the island. Good information given. Have fun

reviews.title: Great cruise
text: I had family who visited me for the weekend and we bought passes for this cruise but when we got there we were told that there are two buses expected at the time and the passes are for week days it was our fault we did not read the fine prints. I spoke to the captain Paul and explained the situation, he was very nice he tried his best to get us on the cruise. My family and I really enjoyed the experience.

reviews.title: Best day on our Toronto trip !!
text: Beautiful island, excellent scenery from the boat, knowledgable tour guides, nice and steady ride.  Highly recommended

reviews.title: A nice trip that I recommend
text: We were passing by Toronto on Sunday and we didn't want to take a very long trip.
The proposed trip takes between 45 minutes to 1 hour with an option of staying on the island if you want.
The boat was good, clean and not very noisy. It was not full and we could move freely and we had enough places for everyone to sit.
I can't remember the name of the narrator but she was good, kind, funny and helpful. She gave good information about the city, islands and events.
I think it is a good service for 15$.

reviews.title: Pleasant Trip
text: Payment was a tad confusing as it was unclear where to go & who to talk to @ the start. The young blonde lady was welcoming & had a pleasant voice & there was much interesting information learned. I'm a Toronto resident & didn't know anything about the islands. The day was overcast & warm. I could see for piles. My son who is 7 & my friend & myself all enjoyed it very much.

reviews.title: Take a break from the city!
text: After sight seeing for over a week, we needed a break from tours and crowds. This boat ride and trip to the islands was just what we needed.   We spent some time on the beach and then rented bikes ($8/hr.) to see more of the island.  If you walk just a little ways away from the bath house area, the crowds thin out on the beach.  The staff on the boat was very personable and helpful. We enjoyed the information given during the harbour tour as well.  The best part was that we got a great deal using Groupon.  Check it out!

reviews.title: Nice boat....
text: We took this boat on our way to Toronto Island. Although there were many other boats, why we ended up with Ste. Marie? Because they could offer to charge the fee with POS machine over our debit card. And all our experience is not a regret. Guide was very experienced and funny. All crew were very friendly. On our way back, they were on time. The boat is clean, and have a bar where they offer soft drinks and snacks for children. Toilets are clean. In summary, I advise you to use Ste. Marie 1 for your trip to Toronto Island .

reviews.title: Boat Cruise Toronto Island.
text: Took this Cruise today.  Well worth it. It's a nice short Harbour trek. Which gives you the option of getting off at the Toronto Island. You can walk around and return to where they dropped you and get back on for return trip to Toronto. The price was $15.00 per. There is also snacks and a bag on board.

reviews.title: Not appropriate
text: I was in Toronto with my husband, just last week and when we decided to do the boat trip, we went to the harbor and questioned  the information desks for tourist and we couldn't decide which tour to pick; the Ste Marie which had the crew pressing tourist to choose this one or the Harbour Tour boat which was considered one of the best on Trypadvisor but had a large queue!... So, being the prices the same, we just let ourselves be influenced by the Ste Marie's crew. As soon as we boarded, we noticed there wasn't enough  seats in the upper or front decks, so we had to stay in the lower deck at the back of the back of the boat. The worst was seeing the mess and lack of safety in this part of the boat.!...
Look at the images...

reviews.title: Spoiled by beauty
text: We really enjoyed our cruise with Ste Marie 1.
We strolled past just as it was about to depart and we jumped at the chance to cruise the TO harbour for $15!!
Even my friend who lives in TO loved it.
Fantastic commentary (but not too much) and a great treat to cruise around the islands.
Lovely & friendly staff. Not too bossy.
Great for all ages.

reviews.title: Beautiful cruise
text: Lovely 45 minute cruise around the islands, crew were great, so friendly and thank you so much Amelia for your commentary and taking so many great photos for us.
Highly recommend this one.

reviews.title: Nice view from the water
text: We were planning to go on a tour with another harbor cruise when we met this at the harbor. Cheaper and smaller, more cozy boat. We're glad we took this. Expect a light informal guidance.

reviews.title: Best cruise! Forget the sightseeing bus combos!
text: If you're looking for a less crowded, relaxed  and funny cruise with best view of the island Park and the skyline choose this one! Price is about 13 dollars and if you see the line waiting for the sightseeing bus combo boat tour you'll choose this one over it. The other boats are too crowded to get to move around and take the shots you'd like to, actually you can't move on the other boats. Book, relax and enjoy and thank me afterwards :) best places are right in front at the tip of the boat. The guys are so funny, they also take pics of you and the skyline if you want. Tips go to the crew's college fund ;) an no I am not getting paid for this good review, just being honest.

reviews.title: Very relaxing
text: This trip was very relaxed with a terrific crew and the commentary was  very good. The boat had plenty of room and even had a well stocked bar with snacks.  There were several young children on the trip and all seemed entertained during he journey. Splendid views of Toronto skyline at a very reasonable price.

reviews.title: A short 45-50 minutes boat trip over calm waters
text: this was our first Toronto water experience. It looks like a pontoon boat. Slow moving and gentle. Top deck is for view and walk around. Bottom deck is closed in case you get clod.

In the middle of summer, it can get clod due to lake breeze. A small bar is available to serve you beer and so on. No meals are served. Crew is 3 or 4 people. Crew gets you a narrative about view and some interesting facts. if you time it correctly, you can do this in 90 minutes. While you are waiting for your ship, there are several shops and eateries nearby that can keep you busy.

It costs about $15 US per adults. Not recommended for a winter time activity. You can check their website for working hours, rates, paths and so on. There are other excursions that are 90 minutes or longer in time with meals served nearby.

reviews.title: Great Waterfront Trip
text: I have taken 2 trips on this ship so far this summer. The boat has an excellent crew who make the trip a lot of fun. The Captain and crew know what they are doing. The snack bar has various refreshments. Gabby supplies the history of the harbour, the islands and assists in photo shoots. It is a good family cruise and within a family budget.
Keep up the good work.

reviews.title: The best one to do!
text: This is hand down the best tour to do - the reason - the upper deck has seating but you can move around as you wish.  The crew are brilliant, friendly and helpful and this feels much less touristy than the one you would do as part of the city tour

reviews.title: Water Tour - Islands and Skyline
text: We had our hearts set on visiting the Toronto Islands but the water level was too high and people were not allowed on the islands so we opted to take a boat tour of the islands.  We were glad we did.  It was May and a lot cooler than we expected out on the water.  (Being from Alabama, we are not used to the cold climate.) There was an upper open air area and lower enclosed area.  The captain and tour guide were both very informative and we enjoyed the water tour.  It was a pretty decent value for the area.

reviews.title: Lovely Sunday Afternoon island tour
text: I bought this Toronto island tour on a Sunday afternoon. I got a great deal on Groupon for $16 with a promo .

It‚Äôs about a 45 minute tour around Toronto Island. It was sooo much fun. We got great seats upstairs and a great view, the weather was perfect. Ashley provided a funny and entertaining guided tour. She kept us entertained during the tour. The boat has 2 floors , so you can sit inside on bench like seats and be covered on both floors. There is a bar to buy drinks and a washroom on board. It‚Äôs a fun quick tour to do, if you are looking for a no frills fun trip

reviews.title: Excellent Trip
text: The crew on this great tour of the Toronto Harbour are top notch professionals. The commentary is educational and entertaining. The view of the city is always amazing.
It is the best choice for a nice afternoon cruise. Bravo Zulu.  Capt. Bruce

reviews.title: Ruben was great!
text: We bought a Groupon for 4 of us go use in a 45min boat ride. After we purchased it said it cant be used on long weekends. We thought great now what! But Ruben said he would honor it this 1 time. He made us very happy and we promised we would give him a shout out.

The boat is smaller. Wooden benches up top to sit on but the views of the Toronto skyline and seeing the islands are great. You almost forget your in Toronto. Wish it was longer than 45mins. Made out busy site seeing day that much better with a touch of relaxation.

reviews.title: Lovely boat trip around Toronto Islands
text: The boys had lovely time on this 45-min boat trip around Toronto Islands. I would recommend this trip.

reviews.title: Pretty Tour
text: The scenery was lovely. The boat was well kept. The drinks were strong. I will say though, that we couldn't hear a word the tour guide was saying. The top deck was full so we sat downstairs and you couldn't hear the speakers over the wind and the engine.

reviews.title: Breathtaking, Marvelous, Unpretentious!
text: The Ste Marie 1 is a lovely vessel that holds 80 or so people. It's not as grand as some of the other boats in the harbour but it make up for it with it's character. The cruise is a 45 min long narrated tour in and amongst the Toronto Islands. The crews narrator was smart, funny and happy to answer our questions. My friends and I enjoyed that we could buy a beer from the bar and walk around the boat taking in the sights. The best part was the view of the Toronto skyline as you leave the Islands and start heading back to the main land. We will definitely visit the Ste Marie 1 again, maybe even book an event on it. Side note : Captain Adriel and Shawn are a woot!!!!

reviews.title: boat smells like a sewer
text: title says it all. Miserable.  Asked the crew to put down some of the side curtains in the back so we could get away from the smell. They somehow forgot about that.

reviews.title: Sweet and short cruise
text: We decided to our groupon for this little cruise. It was right off the habour. The cruise lasted about 30-40 mins which was perfect and it drove us around the habour and around the islands. The staff was very funny with her little anecdotes and information on the islands.
Sadly we were not able to dock and get off on the island because their dock/port was destroyed by the flood.
Tips: plenty of departing time so you can walk around harbour front area if you get there too early. call ahead to see if they will be dropping you off in the island.

reviews.title: Lovely cruise
text: Walking by and decided to take cruise. Same route, price and duration of other cruise beside it but preferred the smaller boat option. Pleasant cruise with easy commentary. Would recommend.

reviews.title: Floating Keg Party
text: See the great blue heron take flight from the wetlands; the majestic white swan tip its neck underwater for a meal; the solitude of Doughnut Island surrounded by woodlands and still waters -- there's just one problem: you can't focus on the beauties of nature because your mind is awash in the unnatural soundtrack of a keg party playlist pumping through speakers at every corner of this boat. No wonder the heron flew away when we thumped by; and the swam may have put its head underwater to block out the noise.
